snippet.title: Trade minister slams 'Qld-first' policy
snippet.content: Federal Trade Minister Steve Ciobo says a "Queensland-first" procurement policy announced by the state government threatens exposure to export markets for Australia. Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk announced the policy at the state Labor conference on Saturday, encouraging government departments to award contracts to local businesses. Mr Ciobo says the policy sounds good, but "the simple fact is you can't open up export markets internationally and then close off Queensland; you either have them both open or both closed". (C) AAP 2017
